intro: Alonsoa meridionalis var. carnea, commonly known as the pink alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
